alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 9:20PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, south central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Pulaski. In east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent. In southwest Missouri, Greene, Laclede, Lawrence and Newton. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A round of moderate to heavy rainfall will likely produce 2 to 3 inches of rainfall. This amount of rainfall may cause flooding of low water crossings, creeks and streams. Additional changes to rainfall forecasts will occur therefore remain weather aware for changes to the Flood Watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
